attributes.action: Pardon those executed as witches in the Lanchasire Witch Trials of 1612
attributes.background: In 1612, 10 men and women were hanged after being found guilty of witchcraft in the Pendle Witch trials in Lancashire, England. Despite the UK government abolishing the superstitious laws that allowed this, a pardon has never been granted for the victims of this injustice.

rejection.details:
A pardon of this kind would be granted by the Monarch.

You could start a new petition asking the Government to request that a pardon be granted by the Monarch in this case.
